resources.string: This is a name of the language as shown on the login form (it is meant to be localized to target language so that user can easily find it).
This is a magic key that huggle uses to determine if localization is right to left or not, write \"true\" here if it is, otherwise put false or nothing there
just a generic continue word (click to continue etc)
Option in menu to revert the edit assuming a good faith (that allows user to provide own reason and doesn\'t affect badness scores)
The target of the check. The user checked.
This can be likely same in most languages. It is a label for column where diff ID is shown.
Displayed in a log window when new user ($1) is inserted to a whitelist. $2 is a number (long long int)
Time when a block is to be expired
Shown when mediawiki doesn\'t return a token
Flags to use for user or edit
This is a title bar / error message that is shown when user wants to perform some action while no page is displayed

This is shown in web browser window in case that api.php didn\'t return a proper diff so that huggle had to switch to \"web rendering\" mode, where page is retrieved using standard html method such as index.php?action=render
Red label that appears in web browser window instead of edit summary in case there is none
This is shown in tool bar as a title of currently displayed page. Title for every diff generated by huggle is build from this string. $1 is a name of page and $2 is score of page
List of developers in about form
Title of \"block user\" window where $1 is name of user who is to be blocked
Message that will be sent to user who will be blocked
Label for checkbox to block anonymous users only.
Option to block account creation for all users that are affected by block of that IP
If this option is checked in block form, the new block will be done using autoblocks (mw feature)
Whether a user should be blocked from delivery of e-mail messages as well
Information that $1 is tagged as a shared or dynamic IP address.
Shown when user start a block of user who is already blocked by another block
Shown in a logs or progress bar
Message that is displayed when it fails to block a user, $1 contains a reason
Displayed when it fails to get a token while blocking a user, $1 is error message
Shown when mediawiki returns no user info, which happens when user isn\'t a sysop during block of user
shown in report box as column header which type the block-logentry was of.
Person who blocked a user in report user form
Shown in log / title of block window
Shown when there is no user to block
Note: currently not used in HG3
Note: currently not used in HG3
Option to remember username for login
Label used next to the IRC Port options in the configuration settings
Label used next to the font size option for diffs in the configuration settings
Label used next to the show tray icon option in the configuration settings
Label used next to the show startup message option in the configuration settings
Label used next to the show new message bar option in the configuration settings
Used as label for the checkbox. {{Identical|Check for update}}
Used as label for the checkbox.
name of tab at login window for OAuth-login.
name of tab at login window for normal username and password login.
Used as tooltip for the button which is labeled {{msg-huggle|Reload}}.
Used as link text for the link pointing to [[m:Huggle/Localization]].
Used as label for the checkbox.
Menu entry to cancel current operation
Menu entry to change recent changes provider (wiki/api-feed or irc)
\"Scorewords\" are words, that when they are present in a diff of an edit they increase the score of an edit by given value. A higher score could imply that the edit might be vandalism.
{{Identical|Next}} Menu entry to process to next edit in queue.
Used as label for the button.
Used as label for the button.

A label for a text box that describes the current screen.
[[File:Huggle3 kde ubuntu.png|300px|Screenshot]]
Unused at this time. {{Identical|Mark as patrolled}}
Used as label for the button. {{Identical|Protect}}
Used as label for the button.
Used as label for the button.
$1 is the name of the user talk page.
Used as success message. Parameters: * $1 - username
Used as failure message. Parameters: * $1 - error message (reason)

Used as window title when the process has failed.
The windows has the message \"Unable to protect the page because \'\'reason\'\'\" (untranslatable).
Used as status that the page is being rolled back. Parameters: * $1 - pagename
Used as label for the button. {{Identical|Close}}
Used as label for the checkbox.

Used in the confirmation message box.
\"userspace\" refers to \"User namespace\".
Used as label for the button to indicate the process has been finished successfully. {{Identical|Finished}}
Used as log entry. Parameters: * $1 - page name
